00033 #include "Mesquite.hpp"
00034 #include "TMetric.hpp"

00041 template <unsigned Dim>
00042 static inline double
00043 do_finite_difference( int r, int c, TMetric* metric, 
00044                       MsqMatrix<Dim, Dim> A,
00045                       double value, MsqError& err )
00046 {
00047   const double INITIAL_STEP = std::max( 1e-6, fabs(1e-14*value) );
00048   const double init = A(r,c);
00049   bool valid;
00050   double diff_value;
00051   for (double step = INITIAL_STEP; step > std::numeric_limits<double>::epsilon(); step *= 0.1) {
00052     A(r,c) = init + step;
00053     valid = metric->evaluate( A, diff_value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00054     if (valid)
00055       return (diff_value - value) / step;
00056   }
00057   
00058     // If we couldn't find a valid step, try stepping in the other
00059     // direciton
00060   for (double step = INITIAL_STEP; step > std::numeric_limits<double>::epsilon(); step *= 0.1) {
00061     A(r,c) = init - step;
00062     valid = metric->evaluate( A, diff_value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00063     if (valid)
00064       return (value - diff_value) / step;
00065   }
00066   
00067     // If that didn't work either, then give up.
00068   MSQ_SETERR(err)("No valid step size for finite difference of 2D target metric.",
00069                   MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
00070   return 0.0;
00071 }

00074 template <unsigned Dim>
00075 static inline bool
00076 do_numerical_gradient( TMetric* mu,
00077                        MsqMatrix<Dim, Dim> A,
00078                        double& result,
00079                        MsqMatrix<Dim,Dim>& wrt_A,
00080                        MsqError& err )
00081 {
00082   bool valid = mu->evaluate( A, result, err );
00083   if (MSQ_CHKERR(err) || !valid)
00084     return valid;
00085   
00086   switch (Dim) {
00087     case 3:
00088   wrt_A(0,2) = do_finite_difference( 0, 2, mu, A, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00089   wrt_A(1,2) = do_finite_difference( 1, 2, mu, A, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00090   wrt_A(2,0) = do_finite_difference( 2, 0, mu, A, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00091   wrt_A(2,1) = do_finite_difference( 2, 1, mu, A, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00092   wrt_A(2,2) = do_finite_difference( 2, 2, mu, A, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00093     case 2:
00094   wrt_A(0,1) = do_finite_difference( 0, 1, mu, A, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00095   wrt_A(1,0) = do_finite_difference( 1, 0, mu, A, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00096   wrt_A(1,1) = do_finite_difference( 1, 1, mu, A, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00097     case 1:
00098   wrt_A(0,0) = do_finite_difference( 0, 0, mu, A, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00099     break;
00100     default:
00101      assert(false);
00102   }
00103   return true;
00104 }
00105 
00106 template <unsigned Dim>
00107 static inline bool
00108 do_numerical_hessian( TMetric* metric, 
00109                       MsqMatrix<Dim, Dim> A,
00110                       double& value,
00111                       MsqMatrix<Dim, Dim>& grad, 
00112                       MsqMatrix<Dim, Dim>* Hess, 
00113                       MsqError& err )
00114 {
00115     // zero hessian data
00116   const int num_block = Dim * (Dim + 1) / 2;
00117   for (int i = 0; i < num_block; ++i)
00118     Hess[i].zero();
00119 
00120     // evaluate gradient for input values
00121   bool valid = metric->evaluate_with_grad( A, value, grad, err );
00122   if (MSQ_CHKERR(err) || !valid)
00123     return false;
00124   
00125     // do finite difference for each term of A
00126   const double INITAL_STEP = std::max( 1e-6, fabs(1e-14*value) );
00127   double value2;
00128   MsqMatrix<Dim,Dim> grad2;
00129   for (unsigned r = 0; r < Dim; ++r) {  // for each row of A
00130     for (unsigned c = 0; c < Dim; ++c) {  // for each column of A
00131       const double in_val = A(r,c);
00132       double step;
00133       for (step = INITAL_STEP; step > std::numeric_limits<double>::epsilon(); step *= 0.1) {
00134         A(r,c) = in_val + step;
00135         valid = metric->evaluate_with_grad( A, value2, grad2, err );  MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00136         if (valid)
00137           break;
00138       }
00139       
00140         // if no valid step size, try step in other direction
00141       if (!valid) {
00142         for (step = -INITAL_STEP; step < -std::numeric_limits<double>::epsilon(); step *= 0.1) {
00143           A(r,c) = in_val + step;
00144           valid = metric->evaluate_with_grad( A, value2, grad2, err );  MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00145           if (valid)
00146             break;
00147         }
00148         
00149           // if still no valid step size, give up.
00150         if (!valid) {
00151           MSQ_SETERR(err)("No valid step size for finite difference of 2D target metric.",
00152                           MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
00153           return false;
00154         }
00155       }
00156       
00157         // restore A.
00158       A(r,c) = in_val;
00159       
00160         // add values into result matrix
00161         // values of grad2, in row-major order, are a single 9-value row of the Hessian
00162       grad2 -= grad;
00163       grad2 /= step;
00164       for (unsigned b = 0; b < r; ++b) {
00165         const int idx = Dim*b - b*(b+1)/2 + r;
00166         Hess[idx].add_column( c, transpose( grad2.row(b) ) );
00167       }
00168       for (unsigned b = r; b < Dim; ++b) {
00169         const int idx = Dim*r - r*(r+1)/2 + b;
00170         Hess[idx].add_row( c, grad2.row(b) );
00171       }
00172     } // for (c)
00173   } // for (r)
00174   
00175     // Values in non-diagonal blocks were added twice.
00176   for (unsigned r = 0, h = 1; r < Dim-1; ++r, ++h)
00177     for (unsigned c = r + 1; c < Dim; ++c, ++h)
00178       Hess[h] *= 0.5;
00179   
00180   return true;
00181 }

00184 TMetric::~TMetric() {}

00186 
00187 bool TMetric::evaluate_with_grad( const MsqMatrix<2,2>& T,
00188                                   double& result,
00189                                   MsqMatrix<2,2>& wrt_T,
00190                                   MsqError& err )
00191 {
00192   return do_numerical_gradient( this, T, result, wrt_T, err );
00193 }

00195 bool TMetric::evaluate_with_grad( const MsqMatrix<3,3>& T,
00196                                   double& result,
00197                                   MsqMatrix<3,3>& wrt_T,
00198                                   MsqError& err )
00199 {
00200   return do_numerical_gradient( this, T, result, wrt_T, err );
00201 }

00203 bool TMetric::evaluate_with_hess( const MsqMatrix<2,2>& T,
00204                                   double& result,
00205                                   MsqMatrix<2,2>& deriv_wrt_T,
00206                                   MsqMatrix<2,2> hess_wrt_T[3],
00207                                   MsqError& err )
00208 {
00209   return do_numerical_hessian( this, T, result, deriv_wrt_T, hess_wrt_T, err );
00210 }
00211 
00212 bool TMetric::evaluate_with_hess( const MsqMatrix<3,3>& T,
00213                                   double& result,
00214                                   MsqMatrix<3,3>& deriv_wrt_T,
00215                                   MsqMatrix<3,3> hess_wrt_T[6],
00216                                   MsqError& err )
00217 {
00218   return do_numerical_hessian( this, T, result, deriv_wrt_T, hess_wrt_T, err );
00219 }

00224 bool TMetric2D::evaluate( const MsqMatrix<3,3>&, double&, MsqError& err )
00225 {
00226   MSQ_SETERR(err)("2D target metric cannot be evaluated for volume elements",
00227                   MsqError::UNSUPPORTED_ELEMENT);
00228   return false;
00229 }

00235   return false;
